name: Mount Carrigain

trails_config.name: Signal Ridge Trail
trails_config.description: Leads to a high fire tower with a 360-degree view of almost every 4,000-footer. Signal Ridge provides dramatic exposure before reaching the summit.
trails_config.parking_info: Signal Ridge Trailhead, Sawyer River Rd, Livermore, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 4700 feet, Mount Carrigain offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4700 feet, Mount Carrigain is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Signal Ridge Trail**, a **10.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **South Hancock**, which is just 2.4 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
